Review.Titre: Absolutely no response from Two Way !
Review.Contenu: I placed an order for two replacement batteries for my Motorola CP200’s.  As the original batteries were about 3 years old. The new batteries arrived, I installed them into the radios, placed them on the charger overnight. The next morning both chargers indicated fully charged (Green LED). One of the radios was completely dead.  I recharged the batterie again. Still dead, I reinstalled the old batterie… radio works fine.  I called the number on my receipt. Explained the issue (obviously an answering service).  No return call, no text, no e-mail etc.  absolutely no response.  I then called another vendor, (Small World Paging). New OEM batteries are on their way from Small World.   Still no response at all from Two Way Direct !!! Be warned.

Review.Titre: After being sent the wrong headset it…

Yes it was by me constantly calling them. Stay away from this company. Total joke!

Worst ever. We ordered a radio in a pinch to get through an event we were short on -  now get marketed from yall constantly. Have emailed multiple times to and spoken on the phone multiple times to stop contacting me trying to sell me stuff. Even after MULTIPLE times of telling me they are removing us from all this spam - still getting contacted. I WILL NEVER buy anything from this company again. We will do without before we use your spammers again.

Review.Titre: Still have not received product ordered…

I understand the supply and demand issues very well. My frustration came when the estimated time came for the delivery date I would have to reach out multiple times to get a response on where the order was sitting. More delays or shipped etc. It wasn't until the last communication I was presented with other options.

I ordered this item on 11/05/2021 - it did not ship until 12/02/2021 - I emailed twice for status updates, received no response. Fortunately, this order was out of my own pocket, instead of my company's pocket that operates just shy of 75 TLK-100 units.

After I posted my review, two days later I received a reply via Trustpilot saying that they would get back with me quickly to try and resolve the issue... That was over two weeks ago. I haven't heard a word from the company since, neither by phone nor email. The silence from this company speaks volumes, and validates my concerns.  One minor correction, I have received an email from the guy who won't return my calls, wanting to know if he can do more orders for me on the same product... a standard, boilerplate follow up email from someone that obviously has no concern over the lack of customer service I'm receiving.

I bought a motorola surveillance mic for my motorola radio. The mic is compatible and meant for my radio. I tried it, although the quality of the product was poor such as low volume. Motorola made a poor product. Now, i contact two way direct for a return. They told me i cant because of covid, which is understandable as i wore it. They asked what was wrong, but never offered any additional help or discount for something help after i responded back. The customer service was poor and would never buy from two way direct especially with the lack of follow up and/or trying to help resolve my issue. Even a simple apology with a discounted mic thats compatible wouldve made me happy.

I ordered the items listed and displayed on the site, and got something that was not even comparable or functional with the equipment listed. When I contacted the company rep, he expected me to fill out some form and pay to ship back the incorrect items at my expense, so they could assess the problem. After that, the rep ignored my multiple phone messages to call me back. This is the second time I have ordered from this company and gotten the wrong and/or faulty equipment, I will never do business with your company again.

Review.Titre: Their products are great and I have no…
Review.Contenu: Their products are great and I have no issues with what I have purchased. However, I purchased the wrong product once and the return process was horrible. After multiple emails (that seemed not to have been read) I was given an RMA number and told my replacements would be mailed out. However, I never received the replacement products and never received a refund. I ordered and paid for the correct product (because I absolutely needed them) and never heard back about my return.
Buy 1 thing from this company and they will spam you with emails you can’t unsubscribe from. Product works as intended but the constant contact from the company is over the top and inescapable

Review.Titre: If you buy from them, you will never hear the end of it. They will spam you till you the day you die.
Review.Contenu: We purchased some radio and radio accessories a few months back to meet a need from this company (as they were the only ones that still had stock of the radios that we have throughout our organization.) Since that time I have been pounded constantly from Vini with emails, phone calls and messages to the point that I told him to stop contacting me which he acknowledged in a response back via email. But over the past three days I have been yet again pounded from email by Vini trying to check in on our needs. I’ve made it abundantly clear to him that we do not need anything and if we did, we would order when needed. But as of today I have blacklisted his company from our organization and refuse to allow any more purchases due to the spammer tactics they use as an organization .

Review.Titre: I Am Not Please In the Least

Once I reached out to someone, I was told that the order had shipped a day or so before, I went back and looked again because there was still no update on the site unless I'm blind. It was still more than another week to get the order via USPS. I used to work for a company that used Two Way Direct commercially; I do not recall this slow or weird of a process working with them. What's worse, now my product works intermittently, and I can't see how to return it because as of today, October 19, 2021, the site STILL says the order is awaiting shipment!

Update: The company is asking for this to be removed claiming they don’t have an account for us.  I have all the back up emails.  If they remove it , I will post it again.  They can’t keep doing their customers like this.  Worst place ever.  They don’t train the sales reps before they let them tell customers incorrect information which causes the customers to try and fix the issues.   The managers don’t respond to emails, their customers service is terrible (non existent).  Save yourself the headache and run 🏃‍♀️ from this place. I wish I could, but in 28 months when my contract is over I’M GONE.  We changed banks and I asked Liam the sales rep how do I update my method of payments. He sent me a form and told me to return it.  I competed it and returned it, then my bank had to replace my card so I resent the form letting them know the card number was the same just a different expiration date and 3 digit code.   When I started getting emails saying we were behind and our service was going to turned off, I contacted Liam to find out the form he sent me was for the initial payment for the radios.  That we had to contact Motorola to change our payment method.   I asked him why he sent me the form when I told him I needed to change the payment information, he sent me an email that said sorry I was new.  So that’s the customer problem that he was new and didn’t know what he is doing.  Well it has turned into my problem because I’m still trying to get Motorola to update my account (no luck yet).  We had to replace 1 battery within 2  weeks of having the radio, oh they would have possibly replaced it but I would had to ship the radio back for them to look at it then (at our expense) than pay for return shipping again at our expense for them to tell us if it’s the radio or battery. Well we just replaced the battery with a Motorola battery.  We had to end up shipping the radio back after a month of receiving it for warranty work (at our expense) since the radio would come on but wasn’t able to use it. They received it May 3rd per my tracking number, but having heard a word that they have even received it. So we are paying for a radio that we can’t use and who knows when we will get it back, our sales rep Liam doesn’t communicate very well. I’m sure I will know it’s been fixed or replaced once I’m hit with shipping cost.  It’s like let’s get that sale then the heck with the customers. This whole experience has been a nightmare.  Again, run from this company.

I ordered an earpiece for a specific radio and I went with Two Way Direct because they were about half the price as other websites and their website indicated it was in stock - no indication the item I had purchased was back ordered. Shortly after I placed the order, an account manager reached out to me to see if she could learn more about my business and communication needs. A couple of days (2) later, I went on the Two Way website to check the status of my order. It's kind of a pet peeve of mine if you take my money and don't ship the item I ordered...I guess I'm weird like that. Fortunately, I referred back to the email sent by the account manager asking when it would ship.  In an early morning email, the manager advised they would check on it and get back with me "shortly."  Granted the word "shortly" could hold different meanings for different people, but I was thinking shortly was SAME DAY.  Shortly was apparently two days.  Long story short, the product I ordered on 09/03 will (allegedly) be shipped on 09/20.  I think most people would appreciate knowing if an item - no matter how expensive or not - is in stock or on back order and then the BUYER makes the decision if they want to continue with the purchase.  I think a fair gesture to make things right would be to ship the item I purchased via expedited shipping - but I'm not going to hold my breath on that.

Better late that never, you should give me 20% off for such poor service next time I order from you.

At this point we decided to go with an easier option and got everything returned, except for this $45 cable. They actually refuse to take it back because it isn't defective. As another small business I can't help but feel this is the wrong move to make, daily we make decisions in the customers favor just to make sure we're meeting every need. In this case our needs weren't even attempted to be met, a simple "Nope, sorry" was all we got. Funnily enough, we spent $50 on the new device that came with all the cables and disks it needed. I'd recommend using another service, the only reason they aren't getting one star is because they called soon after the order was placed to make sure we were in touch. Review.Titre: Good intent unimpressive results (more like 2.5 stars)
Review.Contenu: I recently made an on-line purchase from this company and was impressed with the quick follow-up both via email and phone by one of the sales agents eager to assist with this or future purchases. When the product arrived I realized immediately that I had ordered the wrong item and it would not work with my device. I called the sales rep who, while willing to pursue it, informed me that web purchases were not returnable. The rep did help identify the correct product and indicated he would ask the manager to allow a return of the unopened product I received. Unfortunately the manager held fast to the no-return policy. In today’s on-line shopping environment providing an outstanding customer experience is critical. Winning new and retaining existing customers can make the difference between growing or perishing. I’m disappointed that this company seems to miss that point. While one can call a helpful sales rep at this company to place an order, in my mind that kind of negates the convenience of online shopping.

Review.Titre: Impressive customer follow-up, but undisclosed out of stock caused delays
Review.Contenu: UPDATED REVIEW: Initially having given the company 5 starts, I now have to rate them as 3. I waited 9 days for my order before calling them to find out that they don't have the item in stock and may be another week before they receive their shipment, then they can ship to me. There was no notice on their site when ordering that these were not in stock, which is unfortunate, given I have a particular date I needed to use these at  camp. If you want to place an order with Two Way Direct, I would suggest you call and ask about stock before placing the order online. TrustPilot reviews can be helpful, but Two Way Direct offered me a discount for posting a review, which is fine, but readers should know that the reviews of Two Way Direct on TrustPilot may largely reflect customers that have just ordered and not yet actually received their product. Service experience was certainly 5 starts at the time of purchase, it just didn't hold up through the fulfillment process.ORIGINAL REVIEW: I didn't finish my order and left items in the cart. They sent me an email and asked if I had any questions or needed assistance. Normally I would find that creepy tracking, but in this case I took it as a sign of good customer service — as they offered an 800 number to call for help as well. Seems like a well run business with the best price online for the product I ordered. Looking forward to seeing how fast their fulfillment is, now that they have the completed order.

Instead I found this site and saw all the reviews about items not being in stock and ended up spending more money to get the items from a different vendor in hopes I had them in time for the event. I understand that a good chunk of your business comes from large orders who are used to the invoice process. However your process is not friendly to individual consumers who are expecting to get their shipping information without having to call.

She went above and beyond to ensure we had all the information we needed to make the right decision for our two-way radio needs.The quality of the radios we received is simply unmatched. They're reliable, robust, and have significantly improved our team's communication. Vanessa made sure we chose the right models for our specific needs, and she took the time to walk us through the features and functionality of each device.What struck me most about Two Way Direct was their commitment to their customers. Vanessa and her team made us feel valued and appreciated, and they worked tirelessly to ensure we were satisfied with our purchase. Their after-sales service has been equally impressive, with Vanessa always ready to assist with any queries or concerns we may have.In a world where good service is hard to come by, Vanessa and the team at Two Way Direct stand as a shining example of what a customer-centric business should look like. I wholeheartedly recommend Two Way Direct to anyone in need of high-quality two-way radios and a smooth, stress-free purchasing experience.Thank you, Vanessa, and the entire Two Way Direct team for redefining excellence in customer service!
